title.narrative: Syria Peace Initiative - Building and Bonding Phase III

description.narrative: Building and bonding phase III is a project led by British Council on behalf of a consortium in partnership with Mobaderoon, International Alert, Globally Connected and Citizenship League. The project extends over a 12 months period with 1st of September 2020 as a starting date. The project is funded by GIZ and cofinanced by the European Union and is part of the overall Syria Peace Initiative.
Target groups for the project includes: - Syrians in the diaspora mainly Europe, Turkey and Lebanon - Community based organisations - Civil Society organisations - Local Bodies

The overall objective of the intervention is that values of peace, justice and civil society participation are integrated into the discussions and decision-making processes related to the future of Syria.

This overall objective is defined by the following benchmarks: 1- A joint 'Citizens’ Charter’ has been developed and recommendations have been communicated to national and international stakeholders of the Track one negotiations – highlighting the importance of embracing diverse identities, peace values, justice and participation of civil society in the eventual preconditions for the reconstruction of Syria. 2 - Recommendations emerging from the Citizens’ Charter and community level dialogue sessions have been communicated with local and international networks and key stakeholders.
